steps.title: Thoughtful messages are emotionally significant for those grieving.
steps.content: Thoughtful messages are emotionally significant for those grieving. You can speak about the impact that the deceased person had on your life while expressing your condolences. Focus on offering the family comfort and support when paying your respects . Your meaningful words can begin to help them through the long grieving process. We are here for you. Ask for anything you need and we’ll be there to help. When death hands us grief, we offer these flowers in the hope that beauty and life may prevail. May your loved one's memory be a blessing, and may these flowers bring you comfort during this difficult time. Your loved one's light will continue to shine in our hearts, even as they are gone from our sight. My heart aches for you and your family during this difficult time. May you find comfort in the love of those around you. Your loved one was a special person who touched the lives of so many. They will be deeply missed. I'm sorry for your loss. May our gesture of comfort touch your heart. We hope these flowers help bring a smile to your face. [1] X Research source I am so sorry for your loss. Please know that I am here for you if you need anything. May your loved one's spirit find peace, and may these flowers bring you solace and strength. In memory of a beautiful soul, may these flowers bloom as brightly as your loved one's life. Though your loved one is no longer here, who they were will always remain.

steps.title: Short, caring wishes leave an impression on those left behind.
steps.content: Short, caring wishes leave an impression on those left behind. It doesn’t take a long message to show grieving family members how sorry you are. Express your sympathy with something as simple as “In loving memory.” It lets others know that your thoughts and prayers are with them. Our hearts are with you. Rest in peace. In loving memory. With heartfelt condolences. Forever in our hearts. With deepest sympathy. With our warmest thoughts. Gone but never forgotten. With our deepest sympathies. With love and fond memories. Wishing you peace and healing. Keeping you in our thoughts.

steps.title: Extended funeral flower messages can personalize your gesture.
steps.content: Extended funeral flower messages can personalize your gesture. Longer wishes allow you to share personal memories about the deceased to comfort those who read your words. Use great detail as you recognize the difficulty of the passing when deciding what to say when someone passes away . Wish that the family continues to be inspired by all the good things the deceased brought to their lives. Today is the beginning of a difficult journey of saying goodbye. We share in your grief and are with you every step of the way. There's no way to express my sorrow, so I'll say it the only way I know how: I'm sorry for your loss and for your grief. We stand together as a family. Just as we walk through life together, we'll find a way through the pain that this passing brings and emerge on the other side through love. [2] X Research source Wishing you comforting memories, supportive friends, and kindness to ease your sadness. We hope these flowers help remind you that you are always in our thoughts. Although we are far away, we hold you close in our thoughts and our hearts today and always. They will be missed but never forgotten and have captured a place in our hearts. May they rest in peace. May the peace that comes from the memories of the love you shared comfort you now and in the days ahead. They brought joy, happiness, and laughter to all who met them and will be deeply missed by everyone. May you cherish the joy they gave and the precious memories that they left behind; may they take all our love with them. Our hearts are filled with sadness and tears, but our memories are filled with smiles from the good times we shared over the years. In honor of a beautiful soul who filled our hearts with warmth and laughter. May their spirit find rest, and may their legacy of kindness continue to inspire us. In memory of someone who brought love and light into every room. May they rest peacefully, knowing that their kindness and compassion will never be forgotten.

steps.title: Share your faith to bring comfort to those who are grieving.
steps.content: Share your faith to bring comfort to those who are grieving. Helping a bereaved family find solace through their belief in God can make all the difference. Let them know that they’re in your prayers so they feel supported. Share your blessings to help ease the pain of their loss. I'm praying that God's light and love shine on you in your time of grief. My thoughts and prayers are with you always. Sending God’s love to you and your family. God's love and grace are with you in this difficult time. You and your loved ones will be in my prayers. May their memory be a blessing to you. [3] X Research source I pray for you to get through this time with the peace that comes from the knowledge that God loves you and will take care of you. May our Lord bless and comfort you and your family during this time of grief. Please accept my sincerest condolences. Those who are asleep will awaken on the day the Lord comes for us all. We pray that God will give you strength and courage in your time of bereavement. Take comfort in friendship, prayer, and love. We pray that the love of God enfolds you during your difficult times and that he helps you heal with time. May my condolences bring you comfort and may our prayers ease the pain of this loss. They went to heaven too soon, leaving behind tears and pain, but also joy and good memories. May God rest their soul. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Embrace those who want to remember their wonderful mother.
steps.content: Embrace those who want to remember their wonderful mother. Be thankful that you knew her and let them know that you’ll always remember their mom. If speaking directly to your mother, express your love for the person she was and say how much you’ll always cherish her. Those closest to her will appreciate your heartfelt condolences for the loss of their mother . Sharing in your sadness as you remember your mom. Remembering your wonderful mother and wishing you comfort. Your mother was an amazing lady, and I feel privileged to have known her. I know you will miss her deeply. I’ll be keeping you in my thoughts and prayers. Your mother blessed so many people with her faith and kindness. Praying that you’ll find comfort in your memories of her and in the knowledge that others are missing her too. You’ll always remember how it felt to laugh with and be loved by your mom. I hope those memories will bring comfort in time. Your mom was such a good friend. I loved her very much. It’s so hard saying goodbye to your mom. My heart goes out to you right now. You were the heart of our family, Mom. May you be at peace, knowing the love and strength you gave us will guide us always. In loving memory of a wonderful mom. Her kindness, warmth, and wisdom will remain with us forever. Our hearts ache, but we find comfort in the beautiful memories we shared. Rest peacefully, Mom, knowing you were deeply cherished. Thank you for a lifetime of love and guidance. Rest in peace, Mom, wrapped in the warmth of our love. You were our anchor, our light, and our strength. May your love continue to surround us, Mom.

steps.title: Simply state what a great man a father was in his life.
steps.content: Simply state what a great man a father was in his life. Send condolences for the loss of a father by making your message a tribute to all that he was to his family. When speaking to your own father, express how everything he taught you will stay with you always. The comfort you feel about a father can bring the same comfort to others as well. Your father left strong and loving memories with those who loved him. What a beautiful homegoing. It was truly a pleasure knowing your father for all those years. He will be deeply missed. What a good and generous man your father was. I thought his funeral service was a wonderful tribute to him and all he has done for our community. He will be missed. Your father was such a wonderful man. I was lucky to know him. The lessons your dad taught you, the love he gave, and the way he cared for people will live on in you. Just wanted to say how much your father meant to me, and how much I miss him. Dad, your strength, wisdom, and unwavering love will forever be etched in our hearts. Remembering your dad’s infectious laughter and the countless memories that brought joy to our lives. With tender thoughts and loving memories, we say farewell to an extraordinary father. Dad, thank you for the laughter, the guidance, and the unwavering love you bestowed upon us. In loving remembrance of a father whose kindness, generosity, and love knew no bounds. His warmth and love enveloped us like a comforting embrace.

steps.title: Show appreciation when saying goodbye to a sibling.
steps.content: Show appreciation when saying goodbye to a sibling. Your words can focus on everything they taught their family (or you) during their life. Hope that the family can find peace through their love for each other. If speaking to your own sibling, tell them how special they were in everything they did. Thinking of you all as you celebrate your sibling’s remarkable life. You were my strength in good times and bad. Thank you for everything Time and time again, you showed me how to live. Love you so much. You were more than just a sibling; you were my best friend. Rest peacefully, knowing you are loved beyond words and missed beyond measure. Though you’re no longer by my side, you’ll forever be in my heart dear Brother. Thank you for filling my life with laughter and love. May you find peace, and may your spirit continue to bring warmth to everyone who knew you. Gone too soon but forever loved. May you rest in eternal peace, dear Sister, wrapped in the love of those who cherish you. Your brother was a source of joy and inspiration to all who knew him. May you find solace in the precious moments you shared and the love he brought into your lives. With deepest sympathy for the loss of your beloved sister. Her laughter and light will forever shine in our memories. May you find strength and comfort in each other. Sister, your love and light will remain in our hearts forever. In our hearts, you will always hold a special place, dear sister. In loving memory of a brother who was also my best friend and confidant.

steps.title: Offer condolences while celebrating the life of a grandparent.
steps.content: Offer condolences while celebrating the life of a grandparent. Chances are, they lived a long and fruitful life that deserves remarking upon. Share wishes that they find peace while focusing on how much love they gave during their lifetime. Offer your support to their family in any way they need it. I was saddened to hear that your grandfather passed away. My thoughts are with you and your family. Thinking of you all as you celebrate your grandmother’s remarkable life. Your granddad believed in uplifting everyone he knew; I was one of those people. And I am so honored to have known him. You made the world a brighter place, Grandma. You will be dearly missed. Grandad, though we grieve you now, your memory will live on through us. You have lived a long full life and one full of love. You will live on in our hearts, Grandma. For all the joy you gave our family, may you rest peacefully, Grandfather. Your gentle spirit and loving heart will forever be our inspiration, dear Grandmother. In remembrance of a grandmother who filled our lives with joy and laughter. A grandfather's love is a compass that always points us in the right direction. In honor of a grandfather whose life was a testament to love, family, and perseverance. In loving memory of a grandmother whose kindness touched countless lives.

steps.title: Share your most heartfelt condolences for the loss of a child.
steps.content: Share your most heartfelt condolences for the loss of a child. You may mention how it’s an indescribable loss, and one filled with sorrow. Send your deepest sympathies that the child rests in peace as you offer your support to the family going forward. They’ll appreciate knowing they have friends and family like you by their side. So deeply sorry you have to go through a heartbreak like this. Sharing in your sorrow and keeping your family in our most loving thoughts. Please know that you’re not alone in this unbelievable grief; we are here for you. Our precious one, you filled our lives with joy and love. May you be at peace, held in the arms of angels. You were taken too soon, but your spirit will forever light our way. Rest peacefully, dear little one. In loving memory of our beloved child, gone but never forgotten. May you find peace in Heaven’s gentle embrace. Much wanted & much loved. Never forgotten and always cherished. My heart breaks for you. You can always depend on me for anything. In memory of your beloved. Words can't express the sorrow we feel. Sending you peace and love at this sad and difficult time. They were a shining star and they'll never be forgotten.

steps.title: Mention how special the friendship you shared with the deceased was.
steps.content: Mention how special the friendship you shared with the deceased was. Losing a friend is difficult, so your message can emphasize the difference this person made in your life. Talk about finding comfort during this hard time and how much they’ll be missed, today and always. Let the grieving family know you’ll cherish this friendship and how wonderful it was. Our friend will be missed today, tomorrow, and forever. Thinking of you and wishing you moments of peace and comfort as you remember a friend who was so close to you. Wishing you peace and comfort during this difficult time; they were such a good friend to me. Please know I am here to listen, comfort, and lean on during this difficult time. I hope it brings you comfort to know that I am celebrating the life they lived and am thankful for their impact on my life. Hoping these words will help you find comfort during this time of sorrow for such a wonderful friend and person. Like these flowers, your friendship was a thing of beauty that brightened our world. These flowers stand as a symbol of our enduring friendship, which even death cannot diminish. Like a blooming flower, your friendship will forever remain a precious part of our lives. Your friendship was a rare and beautiful thing. May these flowers express our eternal appreciation. May these flowers carry our love and support to you during this difficult time, just as our friend always did. May the fragrance of these flowers remind us of the sweet memories we shared.

steps.title: Be thankful for getting to know the person who you worked alongside.
steps.content: Be thankful for getting to know the person who you worked alongside. A work family can be just as close as a real one, so focus your words on sympathy and appreciation for who the deceased was. Hope that the family can heal without trying to be overly positive. Offer your empathy to them while mentioning what a wonderful person your coworker was. From your work family to your home family, we are so sorry for your loss. Our deepest sympathies to you and your family during this difficult time. Grieving is hard work, and we know you’re on the path to healing and cherishing loving memories. We are thinking of you and your family today. We hope the time away gives you a chance to heal. May today honor the love they gave to everyone they knew for all in attendance. [5] X Research source We are so lucky to have you as a member of our office and are saddened to hear of your loss. #*We are so sorry to have learned about your loss. We are here for you. I hope this card finds you surrounded by strength and compassion. Please accept our warmest condolences, we are deeply sorry for your loss. Our hearts are saddened to learn of your loss, please know we are with you. May you find comfort in knowing you are not alone, you are surrounded by those who care for you.

steps.title: Choose a heart-touching quote about loss, grief, or the meaning of life.
steps.content: Choose a heart-touching quote about loss, grief, or the meaning of life. From ancient philosophers to modern icons, there are many quotes to choose from that express your condolences concisely. An impactful quote can comfort a bereaved family during the grieving process. It can act as a reminder to help them heal once they are completely ready. “What was once enjoyed and deeply loved, we can never lose, for all that we love deeply becomes part of us.” — Helen Keller “Grief is the price we pay for love.” — Queen Elizabeth II “There is no pain so great as the memory of joy in present grief.” — Aeschylus “The purpose of human life is to serve and to show compassion and the will to help others.” — Albert Schweitzer “There is no greater sorrow than to recall happiness in times of misery.” — Dante Alighieri “Truly, it is in darkness that one finds the light, so when we are in sorrow, then this light is nearest of all to us.” — Meister Eckhart “Not without hope we suffer and we mourn.” — William Wordsworth “A sympathetic friend can be quite as dear as a brother.” — Homer “Developing our sympathetic compassion is not only possible but the only reason for us to be here on earth.” — George Saunders “Grief changes shape, but it never ends.” — Keanu Reeves “When sorrows come, they come not single spies, but in battalions.” — William Shakespeare “Here bring your wounded hearts, here tell your anguish; Earth has no sorrow that Heaven cannot heal. — Thomas Moore [6] X Research source

steps.title: Religious verse has the power to console those in need.
steps.content: Religious verse has the power to console those in need. Biblical quotes deal directly with faith, death, and eternal life for those who connect to their sentiment. They can bring comfort and peace to a family who are experiencing the loss of a loved one. Share a verse that makes a difference in the lives of those left behind. “For it is you who light my lamp; the Lord my God lightens my darkness.” — Psalms 18:28 “The Lord is near to the brokenhearted and saves the crushed in spirit.” — Psalms 34:18 “The righteous man perishes, and no one lays it to heart; devout men are taken away, while no one understands. For the righteous man is taken away from calamity; he enters into peace; they rest in their beds who walk in their uprightness.” — Isaiah 57:1-2 “And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.” — Philippians 4:7 [7] X Research source “May the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, guard your heart and your mind in Christ Jesus.” — Philippians 4:7 “Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted.” — Matthew 5:4 “The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.” — Psalm 34:18 “He will wipe every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death or mourning or crying or pain, for the old order of things has passed away.” — Revelation 21:4 “God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.” — Psalm 46:1 “Fear not, for I am with you; be not dismayed, for I am your God.” — Isaiah 41:10 “Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you.” — 1 Peter 5:7 “Come to me, all who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.” — Matthew 11:28 [8] X Research source

steps.title: Acknowledge the loss.
steps.content: Acknowledge the loss. Your message for funeral flowers should express sympathy and sorrow. While being positive works for other types of wishes, condolence messages can start by saying how sorry you are for their loss. Other funeral flower messages examples include, “With heartfelt condolences” and “With our deepest sympathies.” [9] X Research source

steps.title: Be genuine with your words.
steps.content: Be genuine with your words. When writing a more personal message, be sincere when you share how you feel about the person who passed away. Let the family know how special they were and what they meant to you. Send your authentic wishes or prayers for those left behind during this difficult time. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Offer your support.
steps.content: Offer your support. Let the family know that you’re available for anything they might need while grieving. Show empathy about what they’re currently going through with saying you fully understand. Tell them how you want to be there when they need a shoulder to cry on or someone to help them move through their grief. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Don’t give advice or use phrases that may upset the bereaved.
steps.content: Don’t give advice or use phrases that may upset the bereaved. Messages for funeral flowers are focused on the deceased’s life and being there for their family. Offering advice on how to grieve or what to do next isn’t your place to do. Everyone grieves differently, so what they need most are meaningful words of support. Avoid using the following phrases: [12] X Research source It's for the best. I understand how you're feeling. They lived a full life. Everything happens for a reason. They are in a better place now. You won’t always feel this way. You will see them again someday.

steps.title: What do you write on a flower card for a funeral?
steps.content: What do you write on a flower card for a funeral? Any funeral flower messages you write can express your condolences about the loss. They can focus on the deceased’s life while stating how much that person may have meant to you. These messages can also offer your support to the family and let them know you’re available whenever they need you.

steps.title: What do you say when you send flowers to a funeral?
steps.content: What do you say when you send flowers to a funeral? You can include a message of sympathy or condolence along with your funeral flower card messages. It’s acceptable to share a short, but happy memory of the person who passed away to help comfort the family, especially if you write a condolence letter . You can also include a quote, poem, or song lyric that you feel reflects on how special a person the deceased was.

steps.title: How do you address a funeral flower card?
steps.content: How do you address a funeral flower card? You can address a message for funeral flowers directly to the deceased as a heartfelt way to express your feelings about them. One example would be to write, “In loving memory of [name].” Another option includes addressing your card to the surviving family who will read your message. Sign a sympathy card , “With love,” “With our deepest sympathies,” or “Wishing you peace and comfort.”
